+Heather...

object.content:
An interesting (objective) blog post from an iPhone lover who moved to the Nexus 4. Worth a read.

+Heather Jones You moved from the iPhone to the Nexus 4. How does it compare?
+Ron Festejo Tempted?

attachments.displayName: An iPhone lover's confession: I switched to the Nexus 4. Completely.
attachments.content: First things first, I'd love to get in touch on Google+ and Twitter (@ralf). Over the past few years I've invested a lot into Apple products and services.

activity.annotation:
An iPhone loverâ€™s confession: I switched to the Nexus 4. Completely.

A very interesting read... key for him seems to be the big advances with Jelly Bean and the use of a stock Google Nexus phone versus another manufacturer's interface... I'd venture to say though that a Galaxy S3 is still fine as you can use the Samsung Touchwiz or easily replace it with many top notch launchers such as Apex or Nova... For me the S Pen and great camera functions on the Samsung are keeping me hooked on the Samsung software for now...

The one thing he misses though is iMessenger... now this is the same reason why I have resisted using the Samsung message app (whatever it's name is) as I don't want to be locked into one manufacturer so I'd rather use GMail, or WhatsApp, etc that I know will work on a different device (even an iPhone if I choose another one down the line)...

The link is going viral so you may need to try a few times before the page loads...
